docs.snippet: The problems that cities face in hosting the Olympics, like being left with immediately obsolete venues, call for organizers to develop a more sustainable approach....
docs.lead_paragraph: The problems that cities face in hosting the Olympics, like being left with immediately obsolete venues, call for organizers to develop a more sustainable approach.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column observes degree to which 2016 Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro underlined flaws in Olympic model; suggests giving cities three Olympic cycles to hold games would encourage sustainable, responsible development.

headline.main: Rio Games Highlight Problems With the Olympic Model
headline.print_headline: Olympic Model Is Riddled With Flaws

docs.snippet: The Mets acquired Niese this month to help fill out their battered rotation, but he pitched only a third of an inning after starting the team’s victory over the Cardinals....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets acquired Niese this month to help fill out their battered rotation, but he pitched only a third of an inning after starting the team’s victory over the Cardinals.
docs.abstract: New York Mets pitcher Jon Niese is put on disabled list after existing knee injury forces him off field early in critical game against St Louis Cardinals; Mets go on to win, 7-4.

headline.main: Knee Injury Forces Mets’ Jon Niese to Leave Game in First Inning
headline.print_headline: Mets Quickly Lose Niese to Injury but Still Get a Win

docs.abstract: Court of Arbitration for Sport upholds decision to ban Russia from Paralympic Games due to widespread, state-sponsored doping.

headline.main: Court Upholds Doping-Related Ban on Russia at Paralympics
headline.print_headline: Sports Court Upholds Doping-Related Ban on Russian Athletes at Paralympics

docs.snippet: In this photo by Dita Alangkara, youths play with a ball during a break at Pyongyang International Football School in North Korea's capital. The country has poured funds into the development and training of promising athletes over the past several...
docs.lead_paragraph: In this photo by Dita Alangkara, youths play with a ball during a break at Pyongyang International Football School in North Korea's capital. The country has poured funds into the development and training of promising athletes over the past several years in an effort to fulfill one of leader Kim Jong Un's primary goals — for North Korea to become a global sports contender. The effort is visible in Pyongyang, which has a number of major new or renovated sports venues.

headline.main: Image of Asia: Developing Football Skills in Pyongyang
headline.print_headline: Image of Asia: Developing Football Skills in Pyongyang
